page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This area is at the extreme s.w. corner of Wales,in the former county of Pembrokeshire,now merged into Dyfed,but often referred to as "Little England beyond Wales".It is a coastal region,adjacent to Milford Haven.The land is used for mixed agriculture, with the village of{Dale}(pop.171) being the main centre of population. The entry channels for the port of Milford Haven pass through the sea area which is also used for recreational boating.The land is an Old Red Sandstone plateau about 1-200' above sea-level,drained by 6 streams flowing S and E into Milford Haven.The climate is mild but windy.Rainfall is not excessive,sunshine is above average and there are about 32 gales per year.The whole area is part of the {Pembs.Coast National Park}and tourism is an important feature.
